The underlying type, or null if one does not exist.

IsNullable(EventInfo)

Determines whether the type of an event is nullable.

public static bool IsNullable(this EventInfo eventInfo)

Parameters

eventInfo EventInfo

The event.

Returns

bool

Whether the event type is nullable.

Remarks

Will be false for reference types if nullable reference types are not enabled.

IsNullable(Type)

Determines whether the specified type is a Nullable<T> type.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/nullable-types/how-to-identify-a-nullable-type 

public static bool IsNullable(this Type type)

Parameters

type Type

Returns

bool

Remarks

When nullable reference types are enabled, prefer to use one of: IsNullable(EventInfo), IsNullable(PropertyInfo), IsNullable(FieldInfo), or IsNullable(ParameterInfo), in order to properly handle events/properties/fields/parameters.
